questionListItems.title: What is the estimated timeline to review a proposed amendment to governing instrument that has been submitted via the Charity Portal?

answer.body: The timeline for the review of the proposed constitution amendments will be on a case-by-case basis depending on the extent of proposed amendments submitted.

questionListItems.title: My charity has already obtained the approval at the AGM before submitting the proposed amendments to COC/SA. Is the charity still required to table them at AGM after COC’s approval?

answer.body: The COC/SA may suggest additional amendments to the governing instrument upon review as the COC/SA will review the entire governing instrument in addition to the proposed amendments suggested by the charity. As such, the charity will still be required to table them at the AGM/EGM for approval.

questionListItems.title: What are the steps to file the changes in board members of a charity incorporated as Society or CLG?

answer.body:
1. Please ensure the changes are lodged with the Registry of Societies (via iROSES) for society-charities or the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (via BizFile) for CLG-charities respectively before the updates are filed on the Charity Portal. The data on the changes would be ported over to the Charity Portal in two working days;

  2. Login to Charity Portal; click on “Update Charity Profile” >> “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers’ module;

  3. If there are any existing drafts, please delete and re-create a new draft to ensure the data pre-populated from ROS/ACRA are updated.

  4. Verify the information which are ported to Charity Portal and complete the updates. Ensure all mandatory fields are filled up (marked with a green tick). Mandatory fields which are not completed will be marked with an exclamation mark (!); Declare and submit the updates when all information are duly updated.


**Refer to the E-Service Guide available on the Charity Portal >> Guides, Templates and Awards >> “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” for reference.

questionListItems.title: Will CLG charities be able to add/remove board members directly from the Charity Portal?

answer.body:
No. The list of board members on Charity Portal are pre-populated from the updates lodged with ACRA. Data of new board members will automatically be incorporated while those who have resigned will automatically be removed when a new draft under the “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” module on Charity Portal is created. That said, charities are required to verify its accuracy before proceeding to complete and submit the draft for processing.

 

CLG charities are however able to add/remove key officers by clicking on “Add Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” tab.

 

**Refer to Charity Portal’s E-Service Guide “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” for reference on the steps to perform the updates.

questionListItems.title: Will society charities be able to add/remove board members directly from the Charity Portal?

answer.body:
No. The list of board members on Charity Portal are pre-populated from the updates lodged with ROS via IROSES. Data of new board members will automatically be incorporated in the new draft created under the “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” module on Charity Portal. That said, charities will have to enter the cessation date within the profile of the board member who have resigned/stepped down. The data will be removed when the draft is submitted and processed.

 

Society charities are however able to add/remove key officers by clicking on “Add Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” tab.

 

**Refer to Charity Portal’s E-Service Guide “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” for reference on the steps to perform the updates.

questionListItems.title: What are some of the details which are pre-populated from IROSES/Bizfile when a draft of the “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” draft is created on Charity Portal?

answer.body:
The information pre-populated to Charity Portal includes:

 

  • Full name as per ID;

  • ID Type;

  • ID Number;

  • Nationality;

  • Local residential address;

  • Designation (only applicable for CLG charities); and

  • Date appointed to designation (for CLG charities).

 

**Refer to Charity Portal’s E-Service Guide “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” for reference on the steps to perform the updates.

questionListItems.title: What are the steps to update changes in trustees of a charitable trust/fund (where MCCY is the UEN issuance agency)?

answer.body:
Please login to the Charity Portal >> Update Charity Profile >> Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers.

Charities may add/remove board members and perform the necessary updates directly on Charity Portal.

 

**Refer to the E-Service Guide “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” for a step-by-step guide.

questionListItems.title: Is it mandatory to appoint a Chairman and Treasurer in a charity?

answer.body:
The “Update/Appoint Chairman and Treasurer” section in the Update Charity Profile only allows appointment of a Chairman/Treasurer from a list of governing board members provided in the drop-down menu.

 

While the appointment of a Chairman is mandatory, the charity may select the option “No Treasurer or equivalent” under the drop down list for Treasurer if the Charity does not have a dedicated Board member holding the position of Treasurer (or equivalent).

questionListItems.title: Which board member’s designation/date of appointed to designation should a charity update under the profile of each board member in the “Update Governing Board Members, Trustees and Key Officers” module?

answer.body: For board members’ designation/date appointed to designation, charity may enter the latest appointments.

questionListItems.title: How long does the Update Charity Profile take to be processed?

answer.body: It generally takes approximately 14 days for the Update Charity Profile to be processed. This would also depend on how many changes were made, and is based on the assumption that our officer will have no further queries.

questionListItems.title: How to update the role of a board member if he/she has more than one designation?

answer.body:
If the board member has other roles within the charity, please click “add role”, select “key officer” and specify the designation of the board member as a key officer.


Access the Charity Portal here

questionListItems.title: What are the designations of board members of a society charity which are pre-populated from IROSES to the Charity Portal?

answer.body: The Designations for board members that are ported from IROSES to the Charity Portal are limited to President, Treasurer, Secretary and Committee Members. All other designations (except for the first 3 designations listed above) will be defaulted as Committee Members.

questionListItems.title: If there are changes in the contact person or contact details of a charity (including the registered and postal address), where should charities file the updates?

answer.body:
Please login to the Charity Portal >> Update Charity Profile >> Update Charity Contact Information.

 

**Please refer to E-Service Guide “Update Charity Contact Information” to guide with the steps to perform the submission.

questionListItems.title: Can a charity use a generic address as a primary contact email address on the Charity Portal?

answer.body: There are no restrictions for charities to use a generic address as the primary contact email address. However, please note that besides the dissemination of news and updates from the Commissioner of Charities (including reminders on annual submissions), the primary contact person and email address listed on Charity Portal will be the Office of COC’s or the Sector Administrator’s first point of contact on any other matters pertaining to the Charity.

questionListItems.title: Can a charity use a P.O. Box address as a registered address?

answer.body: No. The system is unable to accept P.O. Box address as a registered address of a charity.
